questions.text: Large numbers of ribosomes are present in cells that specialize in producing which of the following molecules?
Which organelle often takes up much of the volume of a plant cell?
Which organelle is found in plant cells, but not in animal cells?
Which cellular structure helps maintain cell shape?
Which substance would diffuse through the cell membrane most rapidly?
Celery stalks placed in a concentrated salt solution become flaccid (limp). We can conclude that the salt solution is __________________ to the celery cells.
Which process requires ATP?
choices: movement of water into a cell through aquaporin proteins
movement of sodium ions against the concentration gradient
movement of sodium ions down the concentration gradient
questions.correctAnswer: movement of sodium ions against the concentration gradient

questions.text: Endergonic reactions _________________.
Catabolic reactions _____________________.
Which pH curve represents the activity of an enzyme from the human stomach, where conditions are strongly acidic?
When an end product of a metabolic pathway inhibits an earlier step in the pathway, this is called ______________.
The end products of glycolysis are ATP, __________________________.
When CO2 is removed from a molecule of pyruvate, _________________ is produced.
Where are the proteins of the electron transport chain located?
Which of the following occur(s) in the cytosol of a eukaryotic cell?
choices: oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl CoA

questions.text: Most CO2 from catabolism is released during ___________________.
Where does the Calvin cycle take place?
Which statement about photosynthesis and cellular respiration is true?
choices: Electron transport occurs only in cellular respiration.
Cellular respiration occurs only in animals and photosynthesis occurs only in plants.
ATP is used in cellular respiration and produced in photosynthesis.
Cellular respiration is catabolic and photosynthesis is anabolic.
questions.correctAnswer: Cellular respiration is catabolic and photosynthesis is anabolic.

questions.text: The Calvin cycle produces _____________________.
The light reactions of photosynthesis supply the Calvin cycle with ______________________.
Which of the following statements concerning cells of prokaryotes is correct?
choices: Endoplasmic reticulum is present in prokaryotes.
A nucleus is present in prokaryotes.

questions.text: The cell membrane is made of _______________________.
Which type of reaction tends to require an input of energy?
ATP is produced during _____________________.
choices: glycolysis, the citric acid cycle, and the electron transport chain
questions.correctAnswer: glycolysis, the citric acid cycle, and the electron transport chain

questions.text: What are the structures that hold adjacent cells close together and form a continuous seal between cells?
Prokaryotes are classified as belonging to two different domains. What are the domains?
Which of the following may be found in eukaryotic cells, but not in bacteria?
Ribosomes are found on the surface of _____________.
Which structure is the site of protein synthesis?
In animal cells, which organelle contains digestive enzymes?
Which organelle has a double membrane?
Which organelle is found in plant cells, but not in animal cells?
Which cellular structure supports cilia and flagella?
What are the structures that hold adjacent cells close together and form a continuous seal between cells?
The fluid mosaic model says that a membrane consists of
choices: protein molecules embedded in a phospholipid bilayer.
a single layer of phospholipids and proteins.
a phospholipid bilayer between two layers of hydrophilic proteins.
questions.correctAnswer: protein molecules embedded in a phospholipid bilayer.

choices: is a process in which molecules move from a region of lower concentration to a region of higher concentration

questions.text: Human blood has a lower salt concentration than seawater. What will happen if red blood cells are transferred to seawater?
choices: Water will leave the cells, causing them to shrivel and collapse.
Salt will be exported from the red blood cells by facilitated diffusion.
The blood cells will take up water, swell, and eventually burst.
Salt will passively diffuse into the red blood cells.
questions.correctAnswer: Water will leave the cells, causing them to shrivel and collapse.

questions.text: Putting a red blood cell in a hypertonic solution will result in ________________________.
Proteins that pump ions across membranes against their concentration gradients are an example of __________________________.
Which of the following processes includes all the others?
choices: diffusion of a solute across a membrane
transport of an ion down its electrochemical gradient

questions.text: The first law of thermodynamics states __________________.
choices: energy cannot be created or destroyed
energy cannot be transferred or transformed
questions.correctAnswer: energy cannot be created or destroyed

questions.text: Endergonic reactions _________________.

choices: inorganic phosphate stores energy for cellular work
energy from catabolism can be used directly for cellular work
ADP + ℗ store energy for cellular work
ATP stores energy for cellular work
questions.correctAnswer: ATP stores energy for cellular work

questions.text: A noncompetitive inhibitor _______________________.
choices: changes the shape of the enzyme active site
questions.correctAnswer: changes the shape of the enzyme active site

questions.text: When an end product of a metabolic pathway inhibits an earlier step in the pathway, this is called ______________.
In animal cells, the electron transport chain occurs in the ________________.
In an oxidation-reduction reaction, the reducing agent __________________________.
The products of glycolysis are _____________________.
The end products of glycolysis are ATP, ____________________________.
The process of glycolysis breaks one 6-carbon glucose molecule into two 3-carbon ______________ molecules.
During pyruvate oxidation and the citric acid cycle, how many molecules of CO2 are produced by processing one molecule of glucose?
In cellular respiration, carbon dioxide (CO2) is released during _________________________.
choices: pyruvate oxidation and the citric acid cycle
glycolysis, pyruvate oxidation, and the citric acid cycle
questions.correctAnswer: pyruvate oxidation and the citric acid cycle

questions.text: From one molecule of glucose, how many ATP molecules are produced during the citric acid cycle?
During aerobic respiration, which molecule donates electrons to the electron transport chain?
Which process produces the most ATP when glucose is oxidized to carbon dioxide and water?
choices: pyruvate oxidation and the citric acid cycle
the electron transport chain and chemiosmosis
questions.correctAnswer: the electron transport chain and chemiosmosis

questions.text: In the mitochondria, where is the enzyme ATP synthase located?
The ATP made during fermentation is generated by which of the following?
Which of the following occur(s) in mitochondria?
choices: glycolysis and oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl CoA
oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl CoA and the citric acid cycle
questions.correctAnswer: oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl CoA and the citric acid cycle

questions.text: Which of the following occur(s) in the cytosol of a eukaryotic cell?
choices: oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl CoA

questions.text: Where does the Calvin cycle take place?
Which products of the light reactions are used in the Calvin cycle?
The leaves of a plant appear to be reddish yellow. What wavelengths of visible light are NOT being absorbed by this pigment?
Which wavelength (color) of light has the most energy?
The enzyme, ____________________, fixes carbon during the Calvin cycle.
Reactions that use CO2 take place in ____________________.
choices: both the light reactions and the Calvin cycle

questions.text: Which microscope uses fluorescent molecules to visualize specific cellular components?
What is the membrane-enclosed region in prokaryotic cells that contains the cell's DNA called?
The fluid mosaic model describes the structure of:
Which organelle is responsible for packaging and modifying proteins for secretion or delivery to other organelles?
The rough endoplasmic reticulum (ER) differs from the smooth ER because it:
choices: Is connected to the nuclear envelope

questions.text: Which organelle contains enzymes that break down hydrogen peroxide?
The ____________ are highly folded membranes inside mitochondria where the electron transport chain is located.
Which cellular junction forms water-tight seals between adjacent cells?
The endosymbiont theory suggests that:
choices: Mitochondria and chloroplasts were once free-living bacteria
The cell membrane evolved from the nuclear envelope
questions.correctAnswer: Mitochondria and chloroplasts were once free-living bacteria

questions.text: The movement of water across a selectively permeable membrane is called:
When a cell is placed in a hypotonic solution:
choices: Water moves out of the cell
There is no net movement of water

questions.text: The sodium-potassium pump is an example of:
According to the second law of thermodynamics:
choices: Energy can be created or destroyed
The total energy in a system remains constant
The entropy of the universe is decreasing
The entropy of the universe is increasing
questions.correctAnswer: The entropy of the universe is increasing

questions.text: Reactions that release energy are called:
The region of an enzyme where the substrate binds is called the:
When an end product of a metabolic pathway inhibits an enzyme in that pathway, this is called:
Glycolysis takes place in the:
The Krebs cycle (citric acid cycle) occurs in the:
Which process produces the most ATP molecules per glucose molecule?
When pyruvate is converted to acetyl CoA, which molecule is released?
In the absence of oxygen, cells can generate ATP through:
The light reactions of photosynthesis take place in the:
The Calvin cycle (carbon fixation reactions) takes place in the:
The enzyme that catalyzes the fixation of carbon dioxide in the Calvin cycle is:
Which products of the light reactions are used in the Calvin cycle?
Plants that have adapted to hot, dry environments by fixing carbon dioxide at night and performing the Calvin cycle during the day use:
Which wavelengths of light are most effective for photosynthesis?
The final electron acceptor in the electron transport chain of cellular respiration is:
Which of the following correctly orders the organelles involved in protein secretion?
choices: Nucleus → Golgi apparatus → rough ER → vesicles
Nucleus → rough ER → Golgi apparatus → vesicles
Rough ER → nucleus → Golgi apparatus → vesicles
Golgi apparatus → rough ER → nucleus → vesicles
questions.correctAnswer: Nucleus → rough ER → Golgi apparatus → vesicles

questions.text: During substrate-level phosphorylation, ATP is produced by:
choices: The direct transfer of a phosphate group from a substrate to ADP
The flow of electrons through the electron transport chain
The pumping of protons across a membrane
The breakdown of glucose to pyruvate
questions.correctAnswer: The direct transfer of a phosphate group from a substrate to ADP
